body_content.explanation: a tall wild plant with hollow, hairy stems, large leaves, and clusters (= groups) of small white flowers on short spreading stems that form a shape similar to an open umbrella:
examples: Cow parsnip, with its broad leaves and white-flowered umbrellas, seems to edge every road and trail in this region.
The fields are carpeted with beautiful white cow parsnip, their feathery flowers nodding in the wind.
